definition: to drip/to strain or filter/a trickle
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
to be completely honest and sincere (idiom)

sentences.english: I did steadily pick up some crumbs of knowledge .
sentences.chinese: 我還是持續不斷地拾得了一點學問的餘瀝。

sentences.english: This lively wet-market also features fresh produce and butchered meats.
sentences.chinese: 這充滿活力的溼瀝的市場還有新鮮農產品和屠宰肉類。

definition: fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
to pour liquid/to irrigate (using waterwheel)/to water/to cast (molten metal)/to mold
to flow out swiftly/to flood/a torrent/diarrhea/laxative
to accumulate/to hold in store/to contain/to gather together/to collect/depth/inner strength/profundity
(of water) to rise/rising tide/(of women) to get one's period
warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
